results.title: Deflection output circuits
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Television”.
An explanation of vertical and horizontal output circuits for magnetic deflection, staring with the vertical output stages as a typical deflections amplifier. The first part pf the film shows how the sawtooth scanning current in the deflection coils corresponds to linear scanning of the electron beam; it explains oscillations and damping in the output circuit. The remainder of the film builds up the complete horizontal out-put circuit, step by step.

results.title: Defensive riding techniques
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycle safety”.
Defensive riding is avoiding accidents by foreseeing possible dangers and taking appropriate action. Gives three short rules: firstly, try to anticipate and, therefore, avoid mistakes of other motorists; secondly, drive defensively, and heed all traffic rules and signals; thirdly, make sure you can be seen at all times.

results.title: Defensive play. Pt. 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
Dick Van Arsdale demonstrates and describes how a player must “protect” the basket and box out his opponent from chasing his own rebound and get a “good position” from re-bounding. He goes over the fundamentals of team defence and individual defence.

results.title: Defensive play. Pt. 1
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
Dick Van Arsdale of the Phoenix Suns is a rare “four-way” player - equally good at both defense and offense and at ease both as a forward or a guard. In this film, Van Arsdale concentrates on the elements of defense at which he is so outstanding. He shows how a player must learn to position his feet and use his hands properly, shows how to fight over a “pick” and switch on a “screen”.

results.title: Defense of peace
results.creator_credit: Andre Gillet, Marcel De Hubsch, United Nations. Film Board and Atlantic-Film
results.brief_description: Describes the organisation and mode of work of the UN. Animated charts and maps, together with live action scenes, show how the UN machinery provides a realistic method of dealing with international problems. Introduces the General Assembly Security Council, International Court of Justice, Economic and Social council and the Trusteeship Council.

results.title: Defense de Savoir = Forbidden to Know
results.brief_description:
Maitre Laube is a humble lawyer who is called on to the defense of Simone, a prostitute accused of murdering her lover. The lover was actually killed during a holdup, and was a member of a gang which did bullying favors for local politicians. Faced with Simone’s refusal to cooperate, Laube is left alone to unravel a much more complicated plot than he anticipated.

Credits: Producer, Raymond Danon ; director, Nadine Marquand Trintignant ; writers, Alain Corneau, Nadine Trintignant ; photography, William Lubtchansky ; music, Bruno Nicolai.
Cast: Jean-Louis Trintignant, Michel Bouquet, Bernadette Lafont, Juliet Berto, Claude Pieplu, Charles Denner, Barbara Laage, Serge Marquand, Marie Trintignant.

results.title: Defense against invasion
results.brief_description: This film is a dramatic presentation of the bacteriological processes which are set in motion when an immunization injection against disease is given. Originally made to assist the public health campaign of a Latin American government, the film was re-edited for use in American schools, to show children how immunization helps the human body to make war on disease germs.
